results.definition: unauthorized (especially deliberate) disclosure of confidential information
the discharge of a fluid from some container
examples: he had to clean up the leak
The news leaked out despite his secrecy
he had to take a leak

results.definition: an accidental hole that allows something (fluid or light etc.) to enter or escape
examples: one of the tires developed a leak

results.definition: enter or escape as through a hole or crack or fissure
examples: Water leaked out of the can into the backpack

results.definition: have an opening that allows light or substances to enter or go out
soft watery rot in fruits and vegetables caused by fungi

examples: The news were leaked to the paper
